thread.title: Adele dedicates song to victims of London terror attack in emotional shout-out to her 'soulmate'
thread.title_full: Adele dedicates song to victims of London terror attack in emotional shout-out to her 'soulmate'

author: Alistair McGeorge
title: Adele dedicates song to victims of London terror attack in emotional shout-out to her 'soulmate'
text:
Adele dedicates song to her soulmate - London (Photo: Rex/Getty) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Adele has reportedly paid an emotional tribute to the victims of Wednesday's tragic terror attack in her home city of London . 
The singer - who was born in Tottenham and raised in the UK capital - is currently on tour in New Zealand, and is said to have admitted it felt "very strange" being so far away in the wake of the horrific scenes. 
According to The Sun Online , she told concert goers at Auckland's Mt Smart Stadium: "Today there was a terror attack in my home town of London. Adele is currently on a world tour (Photo: Getty) She paid tribute to the victims - and her "soulmate" (Photo: Getty) 
"I feel very far away and very strange not being at home. All I want to do today is just be at home and be with my friends and family. 
"Everyone [I know] is fine, but there are four people that aren't fine. So let's dedicate this to them tonight and to my hometown which is my soulmate. This is Make You Feel My Love." 
The devastating attack left four dead and many others with "catastrophic" injuries , with those dead including an unarmed police officer who was knifed to death by the terrorist, who also died. Emergency services on Westminster Bridge following the attack (Photo: Barcroft Media) The devastating attack left four dead and many more with "catastrophic" injuries (Photo: Barcroft Media) Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
